definitions.text: the syllable naming the fifth (dominant) note of any musical scale in solmization
to a very great extent or degree
examples: the idea is so obvious
never been so happy
I love you so
my head aches so!
he observed the snakes so he could describe their behavior
he stooped down so he could pick up his hat

definitions.text: in such a condition or manner, especially as expressed or implied
examples: They're happy and I hope they will remain so
so live your life that old age will bring no regrets

definitions.text: to a certain unspecified extent or degree
examples: I can only go so far with this student
can do only so much in a day
I was offended and so was he
worked hard and so did she

definitions.text: in the way indicated; ; ; (`thusly' is a nonstandard variant)
examples: hold the brush so
set up the pieces thus

definitions.text: (usually followed by `that') to an extent or degree as expressed
examples: he was so tired he could hardly stand
so dirty that it smells

definitions.text: subsequently or soon afterward (often used as sentence connectors)
examples: then he left
go left first, then right
first came lightning, then thunder
we watched the late movie and then went to bed
and so home and to bed

definitions.text: (used to introduce a logical conclusion) from that fact or reason or as a result
examples: therefore X must be true
the eggs were fresh and hence satisfactory
we were young and thence optimistic
it is late and thus we must go
the witness is biased and so cannot be trusted
they said the car would break down and indeed it did
it is very cold indeed
was indeed grateful
indeed, the rain may still come
he did so do it!
